column4: nalioth; that script put a pretty weird line in my fstab....i mounted it, and for a minute it acted like it was working right.....i deleted a file from it, and moved one to it....but after those two operations, i can't delete any more files off it. wtf?
what script?
winmac_fstab?
the script has worked for hundreds of folks
is it fat32?
open a terminal and type "man chmod"
if it's fat32, change the permissions
the system makes a trash folder on each mounted partition, i believe
you dont like that. use kde. it hides trash(es) everywhere
nfs is a *nix standard and is fairly bulletproof
samba is a condesension to windowd standards
smeg is the menu editor
yeah
in breezy, right click on your menu
i recommend the installsmeg script from the smeg homepage
if it's not in the repos, check sourceforge.net or freshmeat.net (i'm sure there is something)
backports? for what?
that is entirely up to you
if you desire a more modern distro, upgrade. if you are happy with your systems performance now, stay with it
interesting
ubuntuguide is not a good source of info, it waas gettting stale for hoary and has not been updated in a while
google "x forwarding"
do you know whether dapper uses metacity's new compositing manager?
